page.title: 01HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: The {Swiss Cottage}stands in the grounds of {Osborne House},a former residence of {Queen Victoria {(1819-1901).}The Swiss Cottage cost{Â£1000.}The cottage was rebuilt on the site after being transported from Switzerland. It was a present for the royal children where they were allowed to play, a sort of Wendy House. There is still a fully fitted house on view to the public, with all the furniture still as it was in Victorian times. There is a fully fitted kitchen where the children learned housekeeping and outside many garden tools with the names of the princes and princesses still on them. Also outside the cottage is an old{bathing machine,}a sort of caravan which was wheeled next to the sea so the swimmer would not be seen changing or have to walk down to the sea.
